page.title: 06ST. ALDHELM'S PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The school I go to is called St. Aldhelm's Primary School and is in the village of Doulting. It is called{St. {Aldhelm's}because he died in Doulting during a tour of his diocese. There are 104 children in the school who come from{Doulting, Cranmore, Shepton {Mallet,Downhead, Waterlip}and {Chelynch.}The school grounds are almost 50% grass and 50% tarmac or buildings.We have an adventure play ground which has tunnels, a log, and a slide.There is a nature area which was built in 1985 by some of the fourth year boys and girls. In it are some logs, a pond, a paved area, some trees and a butterfly garden. The main school building was opened in 1979 on the 15th November by the{Bishop of {Bath and Wells,}The Rt. Revd. John Bickersteth.
